docs.title: Codeforces Readme Stats
docs.text: An API that generates beautiful statistics of your Codeforces profile as an SVG image, perfect for showcasing your competitive programming skills and achievements on Github.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• 📈 Clean and simple Codeforces stats
  • 🎨 Multiple themes - Theme
  • ⚙️ Fully customizable - Customization
  • 🍀 Open source - MIT License

Want to contribute? Feel free to open a pull request!

docs.text:

docs.title: Customization
docs.text: You can customize the appearance of your Stats Card however you wish with URL parameters.

docs.title: Common Options
docs.text:
• title_color - Card's title color (hex color). Default: 2f80ed.
  • text_color - Body text color (hex color). Default: 434d58.
  • icon_color - Icons color if available (hex color). Default: 4c71f2.
  • border_color - Card's border color (hex color). Default: e4e2e2
  • bg_color - Card's background color (hex color). Default: fffefe
  • theme - Name of the theme, choose from all available themes. Default: default theme.
  • force_username - Forces the username to be shown in the card (boolean). Default: false.
  • disable_animations - Disables all animations in the card (boolean). Default: false.
  • show_icons - Shows icons in the card (boolean). Default: true.
  • cache_seconds - Set the cache header manually (min: 14400, max: 86400). Default: 14400 seconds (4 hours).

docs.title: Themes
docs.text:
With inbuilt themes, you can customize the look of the card without doing any manual customization.

Use &theme=THEME_NAME parameter like so :

![Codeforces Stats](https://codeforces-readme-stats.vercel.app/api/card?username=redheadphone&theme=radical)

docs.title: All inbuilt themes
docs.text:
Codeforces readme stats comes with several built-in themes (e.g. dark, radical, merko, gruvbox, tokyonight, onedark, cobalt, synthwave, highcontrast, dracula).

You can look at all available themes from the theme config file & you can also contribute new themes if you like :D
